text: CPSC 302: Numerical Computation for Algebraic Problems Midterm Exam 1 ¢cwLm: Question 1. (6 points) Determine whether the following statements are true or false. (e) Suppose a function f(z) has a zero z* that satisfies f(z*) = 0. If the derivative satisfies f'(z*) = 0 then bisection cannot possibly be applied for computing z*. If in that interval f(z) > 0 for all z # z*, then Newton’s method cannot possibly converge to z* for an initial guess in [a, b].
